info.title: REST API for Managing Applications
info.description: Describes the REST API for managing applications in Oracle Application Container Cloud Service.
info.x-summary: Describes the REST API for managing applications in Oracle Application Container Cloud Service.

post.summary: Create or Update a CLI-Only Application
post.description: Creates or updates an application that can only be deployed to Oracle Application Container Cloud Service using the REST API or command-line interface, such as a Cloud Foundry application. In addition to the path parameters, you must provide additional parameters and a manifest file. You can specify additional optional parameters, such as memory, number of instances, and service bindings, in a deployment file. See the Examples tab for details.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Name of the identity domain for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service acount

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Restart mode for application instances. The only allowed option is rolling for a rolling restart. Omit this parameter for a concurrent restart.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application. For updating, must match the name of an existing application.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: Runtime environment: java (the default), javaee, node, php, python, ruby, golang, or dotnet. For application creation only.

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: Subscription, either hourly (the default) or monthly. For application creation only.

parameters.name: manifest
parameters.description: Name of the manifest file, required if this file is not packaged with the application

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: Name of the optional deployment file, which specifies memory, number of instances, and service bindings

parameters.name: archiveURL
parameters.description: Location of the application archive file in Oracle Storage Cloud Service, in the format app-name/file-name

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: Repository of the application. The only allowed value is 'dockerhub'.

parameters.name: notificationEmail
parameters.description: Email address to which application deployment status updates are sent.

parameters.name: authType
parameters.description: Uses Oracle Identity Cloud Service to control who can access your Java SE 7 or 8, Node.js, or PHP application. Allowed values are 'basic' and 'oauth'.

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Comments on the application deployment

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List of tags that can be associated with the application.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Name of the region where the application is to be provisioned. Required only on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

400.description: Bad Request. Returned if there is bad input.

404.description: Not Found. Returned if the application does not exist.

429.description: Too Many Requests. Returned if the quota of instances has been exceeded.

500.description: Server Error. Returned if a server error has occurred.

post.description: Creates an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service Application. In addition to the path parameters, you must provide additional parameters and a manifest file. You can specify additional optional parameters, such as memory, number of instances, and service bindings, in a deployment file. See the Examples tab for details.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Name of the identity domain for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service acount

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: Runtime environment: java (the default), javaee, node, php, python, ruby, golang, or dotnet

parameters.name: subscription

parameters.description:
URL of your GitHub repository.

This parameter is supported only for Java SE, Java EE, and Node.js applications.

parameters.description: The user name of your GitHub repository, required if your repository is private.

parameters.name: gitPassword
parameters.description: The password of your GitHub repository, required if your repository is private.

parameters.name: archiveURL
parameters.description: Location of the application archive file in Oracle Storage Cloud Service, in the format app-name/file-name

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description:
Repository of the application. The only allowed value is 'dockerhub'.

This parameter is required for Python, Go, Ruby, and .Net applications.

parameters.name: notificationEmail
parameters.description: Email address to which application deployment status updates are sent.

parameters.name: authType
parameters.description: Uses Oracle Identity Cloud Service to control who can access your Java SE 7 or 8, Node.js, or PHP application. Allowed values are 'basic' and 'oauth'.

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: Comments on the application deployment

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List of tags that can be associated with the application.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Name of the region where the application is to be provisioned. Required only on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

400.description: Bad Request. Returned if there is bad input.

404.description: Not Found. Returned if the application does not exist.

429.description: Too Many Requests. Returned if the quota of instances has been exceeded.

500.description: Server Error. Returned if a server error has occurred.

get.description: Retrieves a list of downloadable logs for an application instance. You must generate logs before you can view them.

parameters.name: identityDomainId

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application

parameters.name: instanceId

post.description: Generates a Java Flight Recorder recording for an instance of an application, which includes profiling and event information. If you started your application with Java Flight Recorder running in continuous mode, the data is retrieved and added to the recordings list. If Java Flight Recorder is not running in continuous mode, then 60 seconds of profile and event information is recorded and added to the recordings list. Download the recordings and analyze them with Java Mission Control.

parameters.name: identityDomainId

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: ID of the application instance

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body is empty.

get.description: Returns the latest automatic (auto) scaling policy for an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application.

404.description: Not found. This means no auto scaling policy has been defined for this service instance. It could also mean auto scaling has not been enabled in Oracle Application Container Cloud Service.

post.description:
Creates and enables the automatic (auto) scaling policy for an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service instance.

The policy defines rules and conditions for when to automatically scale the service instance. Four rules (operations) are supported at this time: scale out, scale in, scale up, and scale down. A maximum and minimum memory can be defined.

At least one rule (operation) must be defined to enable auto scaling for an application instance. If you define the four rules (operations), make sure the conditions do not conflict each other.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the auto scaling policy details for the service instance.

400.description: Validation failed. See the response for errors from one or more sources. Make the corrections and try again.

put.description:
Updates the rule and condition details of the existing automatic (auto) scaling policy for an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application.

At least one rule (operation) must be defined to enable auto scaling for a service instance. If you update both rules (operations), make sure the conditions do not conflict each other.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The request body defines the auto scaling policy details for the service instance.

400.description: Validation failed. See the response for errors from one or more sources. Make the corrections and try again.

delete.description: Removes the automatic (auto) scaling policy from an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application. This disables auto scaling on the service instance.

parameters.name: X-ID-TENANT-NAME
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Application Container Cloud Service account.

parameters.name: appName
parameters.description: Name of the application.

404.description: Returned if no auto scaling policy is defined for the service instance.

get.summary: View the Events Triggered by an Auto Scaling Policy

subscriptionType.description: Type of subscription, Hourly or Monthly

viewApp-activity-response.description: The response body contains information about the application.

subscriptionType.description: Type of subscription, Hourly or Monthly

latestDeployment.description: Shows all deployments currently in progress.

viewApp-response.description: The response body contains information about the application.

subscriptionType.description: Type of subscription, Hourly or Monthly

viewProcessesDef.description: The response body contains information about processes definitions.

name.description: Instance Name. Use this name to manage a specific instance.

instanceURL.description: Instance URL. Use this url to get a description of the application instance.

viewAppLog-response.description: The response body contains information about application logs.

instances.description: Log details of the application instances.

viewAppRecording-response.description: The response body contains information about application instance recordings.

instances.description: Log details of the application instances

viewLog-response.description: The response body contains information about application instance logs.

viewLog.description: The response body contains information about application instance logs.

viewRecording-response.description: The response body contains information about application instance recordings.

recording.description: Recording details of the application instance

viewRecording.description: The response body contains information about application instance recordings.

viewall-deployments-response.description: The response body contains information about application deployments.

environment.description: Environment, such as Java, Node, PHP, Python, or Ruby

autoMinorVersionUpdate.description: Automatic minor version update for patching

processes.description: Show all processes details of the application

serviceBindings.description: Show all service bindings for the deployment

uploadedBy.description: User who uploaded the application package

userName.description: Username for access to the service

viewEnvironment.description: The response body contains information about all application environment variables.

displayName.description: display name of the health indicator

viewHealthCheckServiceComponentVM.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application.

summary.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application service components

health_data.description: Groups the runtime metrics for the Application Container Cloud application vms

viewHealthCheckServiceComponent.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application.

summary.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application service components

vms.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application vms

viewHealthCheck-summary.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application.

status.description: Status of the component. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

status_time.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

sub_status.description: Status of a subcomponent, if applicable.

viewHealthCheck-response.description: The response body includes health monitoring information.

identity_domain.description: Identity domain ID for the Application Container Cloud application.

summary.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application.

service_components.description: Groups the health summary for the Application Container Cloud application.

autoscalingpolicy-response.description: The response body contains the auto scaling policy details when creating, updating, or viewing the policy.

description.description: Description of the auto scaling policy.

name.description: Name of the auto scaling policy. The default name is the service instance name.

policies.description: Groups details about the auto scaling policy.

startTime.description: Date and time the auto scaling policy was created or updated.

status.description: State of the auto scaling policy.

version.description: Version of the auto scaling policy.

description.description: Description of the auto scaling policy.

name.description: Name of the auto scaling policy. If no name is specified, the default name is the service instance name.

policies.description: Groups details about the auto scaling policy.

alarm.description: Groups the conditions for a rule to trigger an alarm.

breachedOnInstance.description: Whether auto scaling is to be performed when an alarm rule is breached on all VM instances or on any of the VM instances. Valid values:ALL, ANY

comparisonOperator.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold values. Valid values: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold (for scale out), LessThanOrEqualToThreshold (for scale in)

metricName.description:
Name of the metric set in the alarm. Supported values are:
  • MemoryUtilization - The unit of measurement is percent.
  • Memory - The unit of measurement is MB.

If you are defining both the scale out and scale in operations in a policy, the same metric must be specified for each operation.

metricUnit.description: Unit of measurement for the alarm's associated metric. Valid values: percent, GB

sampleCount.description: The consecutive number of times data is compared for the given metric. A valid value is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 24.

sampleFrequency.description: The interval in minutes when data is compared for the given metric. A valid value is a positive integer in the range of 5 to 60.

statistic.description: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric. Valid values: AVG, MIN, MAX

threshold.description: The value against which the given statistic is compared. A valid value can be a positive integer or float, in the range of 1 to 100 (for a percent value), and between 1 to 240 (for a GB value).

coolDownPeriod.description:
The number of minutes after a scaling activity is completed before any further scaling activities can start. A valid value is a positive integer in the range of 30 to 300.

If the alarm is still active after the cool down period, the scaling activity is repeated. The process continues until the alarm is no longer active, or the maximum or minimum cluster size is reached.

maxClusterSize.description: Maximum cluster size supported by the service instance. Required and valid only for a ScaleOut rule.

minClusterSize.description: Minimum cluster size supported by the service instance. Required and valid only for a ScaleIn rule.

operation.description: The scaling operation to perform when the alarm is triggered. At least one scaling operation must be defined in the policy. Only scale out and scale in are supported at this time. Valid values: scaleOut, scaleIn,scaleUp, and scaleDown.

tagscreate-request.description: Each tag is a key/value pair.

key.description: Specify the key for this tag. A tag key can contain letters, numbers, dashes (-), and underscores ( _ ), and it can contain up to 128 characters.

value.description:
Specify the value for this tag. A tag value can contain up to 256 characters and is case-sensitive.

Default value is an empty string (if you do not provide a specific value).

alarm.description: Groups the conditions for a rule to trigger an alarm.

breachedOnInstance.description: Whether auto scaling is to be performed when an alarm rule is breached on all VM instances or on any of the VM instances. For example: ALL, ANY

comparisonOperator.description: Arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold values. For example: GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold, LessThanOrEqualToThreshold

metricName.description: Name of the metric set in the alarm. For example: CPUUtilization

metricUnit.description: Unit of measurement for the alarm's associated metric. For example: percent

sampleCount.description: The consecutive number of times data is compared for the given metric.

sampleFrequency.description: The interval in minutes when data is compared for the given metric.

statistic.description: The statistic to apply to the alarm's associated metric. For example: AVG, MIN, MAX

threshold.description: The value against which the given statistic is compared.

coolDownPeriod.description: The number of minutes after a scaling activity is completed before any further scaling activities can start.

maxClusterSize.description: Maximum cluster size supported by the service instance when scaling out.

minClusterSize.description: Minimum cluster size supported by the service instance when scaling in.

operation.description: The scaling operation to perform when the alarm is triggered. For example: scaleOut, scaleIn

source.description: Name of the alarm attribute that is causing the error. For example: threshold

status.description: Description of the operation status. For example: Bad Request

activites-response.description: The response body contains the events and activities triggered by the auto scaling policy.

items.description: Groups the events triggered by one or more rules defined in the auto scaling policy.

event.description: The event triggered by a rule. For example: MemoryUtilization <= 10 percent

operation.description: Name of the operation performed, either scaleIn or scaleOut.

receiveTime.description: Date and time the event was received.

status.description: Status of the event. For example: Scaling succeeded

time.description: Date and time of the activity.

memory.description: Memory configuration for function. Default value is 128MB.

timeout.description: Timeout configuration for function in seconds.

tags.name: Automatic Scaling
tags.description: Manage automatic (auto) scaling out and scaling in of Oracle Application Container Cloud Service applications.

tags.name: Health Monitoring
tags.description: Return health monitoring data for the specified Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application.

tags.name: Application Life Cycle
tags.description: Manage the life cycles of Oracle Application Container Cloud Service applications.

tags.name: Application Deployment
tags.description: List deployments of an Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application.

tags.name: Application Instance Life Cycle
tags.description: Manage the life cycles of Oracle Application Container Cloud Service application instances.

tags.name: Logs and Recordings
tags.description: Manage logs and recordings for Oracle Application Container Cloud Service instances. Logs and recordings are stored in and downloadable from Oracle Storage Cloud Service.
